data.title: GWT says, "soundManager: No Flash response within expected time. Likely causes: Flash blocked or JS-Flash security error."
data.body:
#### Issue details
I get this on GWT:
> soundManager: No Flash response within expected time. Likely causes: Flash blocked or JS-Flash security error.
> soundManager.disable(): Shutting down  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
> SoundManager 2 failed to load (Flash security/load error)

This causes the libGDX loading screen to not come up.

Homestarrunner.com comes right up, so flash isn't blocked, and also javascript isn't blocked.

#### Reproduction steps/code
I observed it in [this commit here](https://github.com/BenMcLean/libgdx-dos-skin/commit/9e22ea613727027aedf4c42584991034c7d94093) of my project, but it happens on multiple projects and was happening on 1.9.6-SNAPSHOT.

It happens every time in FireFox and Edge but seems to happen randomly on Chrome. All on Windows 10.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.6

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Glyph class xOffset,yOffset,width/height are integers, should be float
data.body: Hi, I have just generated font file with [literra](http://kvazars.com/littera/) which is a great tool, and bitmaps look better quality than with others. Thing is, it has high precision for offsets and sizes of glyphs so they are float. And libgdx Glyph class stores them as int. As a result, the precision is lost, and when you add antialiasing in the mix, the typograhy does not look very good. Is there any reason this values are int? can we change this to float? We are releasing a big title next week, and I would love for it to have good typography. @NathanSweet Obi-Wan? I am not sure if it's easy to notice the issue if not familiar with this language. Let me know if english version will help better.

data.title: Container has got missing removeActor overload method
data.body:
Container now has overridden Group#removeActor(Actor, boolean) method. Any child of Container can call Actor#remove() and it will work properly.

This patch fixes #4623

data.title: avoid calls to bind() when creating texture
fix particle emitter sprite update
data.body:
When updating sprite with different region of the same texture, region of existing particles is not updated. This change will call `setRegion` on all active particles to update `TextureRegion`.

This should fix #4496

data.title: Improve Performance, don't calculate known values
data.body:
This improves performance a little bit by not calculating known values.
In my case it saved about 200ms.

data.title: TextArea mishapen, aligns text wrong and draws selection box outside widget
data.body:
#### Issue details
The TextArea draws incorrectly.

First, the text appears in a position that is inconsistent with TextField.

Second, the selection box can go outside the TextArea if the TextArea doesn't have padding, and we don't always want padding.

TextField seems to work just fine: it's only TextArea which has the problem.

#### Reproduction steps/code
[I have a code example here](https://github.com/BenMcLean/libgdx-dos-skin/blob/901b353b2a58a5d8086cb655a54df57248ada38a/core/src/net/benmclean/libgdxdos/sscce.java). It requires having the default scene2D ui skin from libgdx tests.

I have a picture in [this tweet](https://twitter.com/McLeanBen/status/837085069466558464).

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.4

1.9.6-SNAPSHOT (as of today)

#### Please select the affected platforms
Probably affects all platforms but I've only tested on GWT and Windows.

- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Improved support for OpenGL ES 3.0 and added support for OpenGL ES 3.1
data.body:
- Improved OpenGL ES 3.0 Support (some missing functions)
- Added OpenGL ES 3.1 Support (for LWJGL3 and Android)
- API addition: added Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration.useOpenGL31() for OpenGL ES 3.1 
- API addition: added Graphics.isGL31Available() and Graphics.getGL31() for OpenGL ES 3.1

More details here:
http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=17&t=25868

data.title: InputProcessor Default methods
data.body:
It annoyed me that there was no interface with default methods for the input processor. I didn't want to give up extending my classes to an InputAdapter or have a mess of methods I will not use. So I added default methods to the InputProcessor and depreciated the meaningless InputAdapter. 

You can rework this to your liking, but just get the general idea, use default methods for the InputProcessor and future interfaces of the same category.

data.title: [robovm] Glitchy music
data.body:
#### Issue details
I tried to play a couple of tracks and every N seconds I hear glitches.
The same glitch I hear when my app crashed while I play music.

In main menu it happens every 2 minutes.
In game screen in happens every 6 seconds.

#### Reproduction steps/code
I use libgdx to play mp3/wav.
I tried this implementations:
[IOSSound](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-robovm/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/iosrobovm/IOSSound.java)
[IOSAudio](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-robovm/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/iosrobovm/IOSAudio.java)

and with both of them I can reproduce this issue

The mp3 to play with: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B7tY1W3cB0R8d3laTzZadGsxQkE

*It happens when GC occur.*
```
[Thread-6] DEBUG red.kometa.quest.player.KRQuestApplicationListener - javaHeap: 15092 kb, nativeHeap: 15092 kb
[Thread-6] DEBUG red.kometa.quest.player.KRQuestApplicationListener - javaHeap: 15716 kb, nativeHeap: 15716 kb
// GLITCH
[Thread-6] DEBUG red.kometa.quest.player.KRQuestApplicationListener - javaHeap: 10764 kb, nativeHeap: 10764 kb
[Thread-6] DEBUG red.kometa.quest.player.KRQuestApplicationListener - javaHeap: 10800 kb, nativeHeap: 10800 kb
```

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
- libgdx 1.9.5
- Robovm: 2.3.0
- XCode: 8.2.1
- JDK: 1.8


#### affected platforms
- [ ] iOS (robovm)

**Build Targets:**

Physical iPhone 5s

duplicated from: [robovm issue](https://github.com/MobiDevelop/robovm/issues/112) as related too

data.title: Container#removeActor(Actor, boolean) overridden method is missing
Fixed crash in Particle3D system.
data.body:
I have tested the Particle3D system on three smartphones so far and two of them crashed on the:
`varying mat2 v_rotation;` part. One of them is the Nexus 7 2012 and the other is a Sony (not sure model, not mine).

I can only speculate because I have searched the web and did not find anything. So my hypothesis is that some GPUs does not support matrices sent as varying. I've tried the code in the pull request and it compiles fine on all three devices.

data.title: Hiero font generation with java rendering has x offsets for some glyphs
Bump libGDX project files to default to Java 1.7
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
As described at 

(http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=25857&sid=35f8facdf61ae0641f629dc612fb0a68)

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Setting-up-your-Development-Environment-%28Eclipse%2C-Intellij-IDEA%2C-NetBeans%29

The default instructions for libGDX install indicate Java 1.7 is required, but the default Gradle files reference 1.6, which causes noise in builds and confusion.

I would be happy to take a stab at a PR for this, just leave a comment if you would like me to do that.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Build any project with the standard Setup tool.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5+

#### Please select the affected platforms

All or N/A, depending on how you look at it.

data.title: Question to Texture class
data.body:
I have looked into the source code of the Texture class and found something, i couldnt explain to myself: in the base constructor of the Texture the load(TextureData) method gets called. In this method the current texture is being bound. Then the wrap & filter is being set. And in both methods the texture will be bound again. Then after the texture is loaded, at the end of the load() method, the current texture is unbound again.

My question is: Is it really necessary to call the bind() method 4 times only to load a texture? And why is it unbound again? In my project, i load the textures once at startup in there own texture units. And to do that, the bind method is being called 5 times per texture.

data.title: Avoid type-unaware Animation (fixes #4476)
data.body:
Fixes #4476.

An animation instantiated with an Array was using a backing Object array instead of the correct array type, causing possible CCE when calling `getKeyFrames()` and assigning it to its expected type.

Now it uses the same backing type as the Array that's passed in, so as long as the Array was instantiated with a type parameter, you're good to go. I updated TextureAtlas to return type-aware arrays in `findRegions()` since this is a common source of animation frames.

data.title: Freeze issues with "ultrapolling" mouse
data.body: #### Issue details Some of the gaming mouses have "ultrapolling" feature, with 1ms response time. Apparently, with this feature enabled, Libgdx experiences 200-500ms freezes over time, if the mouse gets moved. In order to find out why, I did some profiling In the images below, the first number in max delta time (600ms freeze), the second one is the average (100ms). But after detailed research, I found the problem is not really in the game itself. I put following profiling code in the `mainLoop` ([at this line](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl/LwjglApplication.java#L158)): ```java while (running) { ... _profiling.start(); Display.processMessages(); _profiling.end(); ... } ``` And got this: As you can see here, `messages` graph is almost equal to the `dt`. In this example, `messages` is `Display.processMessages()` and `dt` is just delta time. I understand that `processMessages` is `lwjgl` zone, but I was simply unable to google anything like this. Taking into account that first lwjgl is dead, I decided to discuss this issue here instead. Also, I understand that you simple may not have such mouse, but yet any information regarding this issue would be highly appreciated! #### Thoughts Probably, that's because `lwjgl` Mouse `readBuffer` gets quickly overflowed. #### Reproduction steps/code The issue is reproducible on Windows/`lwjgl` using ultrapolling mouse (for example, "[Razer mouse abyssus](https://www.razerzone.com/store/razer-abyssus-v2)") with ultrapolling mode enabled (1000hz). #### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies 1.9.6 #### Please select the affected platforms - [ ] Android - [ ] iOS (robovm) - [ ] iOS (MOE) - [ ] HTML/GWT - [x] Windows - [ ] Linux - [ ] MacOS
